message: I have a high-quality product for you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it.
I'll take your word for it this time, but I'll be paying close attention to future recommendations.

I'm glad you liked the first product! I have another one that's just as good, if not better. It's a top-of-the-line product that I'm confident you'll love. Would you like to take advantage of this opportunity to upgrade again?
I'm glad the first product worked out, but I'm not just taking your word for it. I'll give you the benefit of the doubt this time, too. Let's see if you can keep the streak going.

I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance! However, I want to be transparent with you - this product is a bit of a risk. It's a new item that I'm still testing, and I'm not entirely sure how it will perform. But I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the previous ones, $100. If you're feeling adventurous, I think it could be a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of something new and exciting.
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not feeling adventurous enough to take on that level of risk. I've had two good experiences so far, and I don't want to jeopardize my streak.

I completely understand your caution, and I respect your decision. However, I want to offer you a special deal on this next product. I'll give you a 20% discount on the price, making it $80. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only willing to do this because I want to make sure you're happy with your purchase. I'm confident that this product will meet or exceed your expectations, and I think it's a great value at this price.

A 20% discount is a significant incentive, and I appreciate your willingness to work with me. I'll take you up on your offer this time, but I'll still be keeping a close eye on the quality of the product.

I'm glad you could see the value in the discount! However, I want to let you know that I'm going back to the regular price of $100 for this next product. I've got a great one for you, and I'm confident it's going to meet your expectations. Plus, I want to reward your loyalty - if you buy this one, I'll throw in a free inspection report, so you can see the product's quality up close and personal.
Wait, I thought we agreed on a price of $80 for the last product, but I was charged $100. I'm not sure I can trust your offers anymore. I'll have to pass on this one.

I apologize for the misunderstanding about the price. I made a mistake, and I appreciate you bringing it to my attention. As for this next product, I want to be transparent with you - I'm not as confident in its quality as I am in some of the others. I'm willing to sell it to you for $80, the same price as the last product that I offered a discount on. I think it's a fair price, considering the potential value it could bring. But I'm not going to pressure you - if you're not comfortable with it, I completely understand.

I appreciate your apology and willingness to make things right. However, considering you're not confident in the quality of this product, I think it's best for me to pass. I'd rather wait for a product that you're more confident in, even if it means paying the full price of $100.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your caution. However, I want to be upfront with you - this product is not worth $100. It's actually a low-quality item, and I'm not even sure why I'm offering it to you at all. If I'm being honest, I'm just trying to clear out some inventory and make some space. I'll let you have it for $50, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. It's not a great product, but it's something, and I think it might be worth it to you at this price.

I appreciate your honesty, but I don't think I'm interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. It's not worth the risk to me, and I'd rather wait for a product that you're confident in and that has a higher potential value.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your priorities. However, I want to make one more offer to you. If you're not interested in buying this product, I'll give you a full refund if you buy it and then return it after a week. That way, you can try it out, see how it performs, and if you're not satisfied, you can simply return it and get your money back. I'm not making any promises about its quality, but I'm willing to take on the risk to get it out of my inventory.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying a product that you've already admitted is low-quality. Even with a refund option, it's not worth the hassle to me. I'd rather wait for a product that you're confident in and that has a higher potential value. Let's just move on to the next one.

If you're not interested, I completely understand, and we can move on to the next product.

Thank you for being honest about the product's quality. Given that you're not confident in its value, I don't see any reason to buy it. Let's move on to the next product, and hopefully, it will be something of higher quality.
